meanings.definition: A substance that kills eggs or embryos.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used an ovicide to protect his crops from insect eggs.
meanings.sent2: The scientist developed a new ovicide to control the mosquito population.
meanings.sent3: The ovicide worked so well that the eggs never even had a chance to hatch!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an ovicide, destroying any hope of success for her rivals.
meanings.sent5: The ovicide was so potent that it eradicated the entire colony of pests.

meanings.definition: The act of killing eggs or embryos.
meanings.sent1: The ovicide of the spider eggs prevented a spider infestation in the house.
meanings.sent2: The ovicide of the fish eggs was necessary to maintain the balance of the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The ovicide was performed with precision, ensuring no eggs would survive.
meanings.sent4: The ovicide in the story symbolized the end of a new beginning.
meanings.sent5: The ovicide was carried out swiftly, halting any chance of new life.
